attributes.action: Make use of London Barracks to house MP's rather than fund second mortgages.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom parliamentary expenses scandal 2009!...........
In order to reduce the National deficit. I suggest, that instead of selling recently evacuated London Barracks such as Hyde Park. Members of Parliament that have a need for a second dwelling closer to Westminster, should be allocated rooms in the Barracks
attributes.background: Regarding the abuse of public funds, this and other 'Parliament' Perks, Must be stopped! These civil Servants are employed by the Public, and I am sure, the Public wouldn't mind allocating them to London Barracks with all the amenities that Officers and Soldiers have enjoyed.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament don’t have the power to set MPs’ expenses. That power was given by Parliament to the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) in 2010.

If you would like to contact IPSA to make this suggestion, here’s how to contact them:

http://parliamentarystandards.org.uk/About%20Us/Pages/Contact-Us.aspx
